search_parameters.q: Aretha Franklin, age, music related skills + abilities + occupations, proficiency in each, and current residence location (city, state)

text_blocks.snippet: As of 2026, it has been over seven years since the passing of Aretha Franklin. She died on August 16, 2018, at the age of 76.
Aretha Franklin was a multi-faceted artist widely recognized for her mastery across several roles:

list.snippet: Singer: Known globally as the "Queen of Soul".
Songwriter: Penned or co-wrote many of her hits, including "Think" and "Rock Steady".
Pianist: A self-taught prodigy who played by ear and accompanied herself throughout her career.
Record Producer / Arranger: Frequently contributed to the production and musical arrangement of her own recordings.
Actress: Notably appeared in films such as The Blues Brothers (1980).

text_blocks.snippet: Franklin is regarded as one of the most technically proficient and influential musicians in history.

list.snippet: Range: Possessed a powerful four-octave vocal range.
Genre Versatility: Effortlessly commanded styles including Soul, R&B, Gospel, Jazz, Pop, Rock, and even Opera (notably her 1998 performance of "Nessun Dorma").
Technical Mastery: Famous for her groundbreaking use of melisma (singing multiple notes on one syllable) and her precise breath control.
Although she never learned to read music, she was an accomplished pianist who utilized a "magic" and "inspirational" style that drew praise from other elite musicians like Elton John and Carole King.
Renowned for her ability to "re-invent" songs written by others, such as her iconic cover of Otis Redding’s "Respect," which she transformed into a civil rights and feminist anthem.
Current Location: Aretha Franklin is interred at Woodlawn Cemetery in Detroit, Michigan.
Final Residence: At the time of her death in 2018, she resided at her home in Riverfront Towers, Detroit, Michigan.
